required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Keratoconus With PALK Versus PK
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Keratoconus With Pachymetry Assisted Laser Keratoplasty (PALK) Versus Penetrating Keratoplasty (PK)

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the visual results of patients with keratoconus treated with one of two techniques: penetrating keratoplasty (PK) vs. pachymetry and Excimer laser assisted lamellar keratoplasty (PALK).

primary_outcome.description: Uncorrected and corrected distance visual acuity

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the pachymetric maps with a Scheimpflug-Placido device (Sirius). Measurement in microns

secondary_outcome.measure: Corneal aberrometry: Coma, spherical aberration and trefoil
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the corneal aberrations including coma, spherical aberration and trefoil, with a Scheimpflug-Placido device (Sirius)

secondary_outcome.measure: Corneal measurements: anterior and posterior elevation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the elevation (anterior and posterior), maps with a Scheimpflug-Placido device (Sirius). Measurement in diopters
Evaluation of the keratometric map with a Scheimpflug-Placido device (Sirius). Measurement in diopters

arm_group.description: Pachymetry and Excimer laser assisted lamellar keratoplasty

intervention.intervention_name: Pachymetry and Excimer laser assisted lamellar keratoplasty
intervention.description: Ablation profile focusing on topography and pachymetry with Schwind Amaris excimer laser
Fluoroquinolone topical antibiotic (Moxifloxacin, Vigamox) and topical steroid (Prednisolone Acetate Ophthalmic Suspension, Pred Forte)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of keratoconus grades III or IV in the Amsler Krumeich classification.
- Need of surgical procedure
- No endothelial scar
- Best corrected visual acuity <20/40
- Contact lens intolerance
- Imagenological map pachymetric acquisition over 90% at 9 mm corneal diameter
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication for any of the techniques evaluated.
- Requiring additional surgical procedures.
- Diagnostic of other ectasia that were not primary keratoconus.

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto de Oftalmologia Conde de Valenciana
